description:
Following the instructions here, with a few tweaks:  http://wiki.openstack.org/HypervInstall.  I am getting the following error while trying to start compute:

2011-04-08 12:23:21,799 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Inner Exception: No module named no
vaclient from (pid=1836) import_class c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py:65
2011-04-08 12:23:21,799 ERROR nova [-] in Service.create()
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 270, in serve
(nova): TRACE:     services = [Service.create()]
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 173, in create
(nova): TRACE:     report_interval, periodic_interval)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 72, in __init__
(nova): TRACE:     manager_class = utils.import_class(self.manager_class_name)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py", line 66, in import_clas
s
(nova): TRACE:     raise exception.NotFound(_('Class %s cannot be found') % clas
s_str)
(nova): TRACE: NotFound: Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE:
2011-04-08 12:23:21,815 CRITICAL nova [-] Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "nova-compute", line 48, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     service.serve()
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 270, in serve
(nova): TRACE:     services = [Service.create()]
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 173, in create
(nova): TRACE:     report_interval, periodic_interval)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 72, in __init__
(nova): TRACE:     manager_class = utils.import_class(self.manager_class_name)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py", line 66, in import_clas
s
(nova): TRACE:     raise exception.NotFound(_('Class %s cannot be found') % clas
s_str)
(nova): TRACE: NotFound: Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE:

Here is my nova.conf:

--verbose
--nodaemon
--fake_network=True
--network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatManager
--cc_host=184.106.53.107
--routing_source_ip=184.106.53.107
--auth_driver=nova.auth.dbdriver.DbDriver
--connection_type=hyperv
--rabbit_host=184.106.53.107
--sql_connection=mysql://USERHERE:PASSHERE@184.106.53.107/nova
--use_s3=False
--images_path=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual hard disks\images
--instances_path=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual hard disks\instances
--s3_host=184.106.53.107

Latest trunk from source, Win2K8 R2, hyperV.
title: nova-compute on HyperV will not start using latest trunk

comments.content:
Following the instructions here, with a few tweaks:  http://wiki.openstack.org/HypervInstall.  I am getting the following error while trying to start compute:

2011-04-08 12:23:21,799 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Inner Exception: No module named no
vaclient from (pid=1836) import_class c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py:65
2011-04-08 12:23:21,799 ERROR nova [-] in Service.create()
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 270, in serve
(nova): TRACE:     services = [Service.create()]
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 173, in create
(nova): TRACE:     report_interval, periodic_interval)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 72, in __init__
(nova): TRACE:     manager_class = utils.import_class(self.manager_class_name)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py", line 66, in import_clas
s
(nova): TRACE:     raise exception.NotFound(_('Class %s cannot be found') % clas
s_str)
(nova): TRACE: NotFound: Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE:
2011-04-08 12:23:21,815 CRITICAL nova [-] Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "nova-compute", line 48, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     service.serve()
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 270, in serve
(nova): TRACE:     services = [Service.create()]
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 173, in create
(nova): TRACE:     report_interval, periodic_interval)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\service.py", line 72, in __init__
(nova): TRACE:     manager_class = utils.import_class(self.manager_class_name)
(nova): TRACE:   File "c:\openstack\nova\nova\utils.py", line 66, in import_clas
s
(nova): TRACE:     raise exception.NotFound(_('Class %s cannot be found') % clas
s_str)
(nova): TRACE: NotFound: Class ComputeManager cannot be found
(nova): TRACE:

Here is my nova.conf:

--verbose
--nodaemon
--fake_network=True
--network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatManager
--cc_host=184.106.53.107
--routing_source_ip=184.106.53.107
--auth_driver=nova.auth.dbdriver.DbDriver
--connection_type=hyperv
--rabbit_host=184.106.53.107
--sql_connection=mysql://USERHERE:PASSHERE@184.106.53.107/nova
--use_s3=False
--images_path=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual hard disks\images
--instances_path=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual hard disks\instances
--s3_host=184.106.53.107

Latest trunk from source, Win2K8 R2, hyperV.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wayne-walls

comments.content: easy_install python-novaclient is now a requirement, that fixed this issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wayne-walls
